post_text: Secondary Families (Grade 6 -12) - HBC Secondary staff are getting ready for Outdoor Open House on Wednesday, Sept. 2nd from 4:30 - 7:30 PM. Students can meet their teachers, pick up printed schedule, pick up Chromebook (9-12), put lunch money into acct. See you tomorrow!

post_text: H-BC is coming back to school! When?-- September 8 for Gr. 6-12 and September 9 Grades K-5. How?-- In person/traditional Gr. K-5 and Hybrid Gr. 6-12. All students attend at buildings everyday. Be on the lookout for district transportation, if you signed up for that service.

post_text:
Greetings Hills-Beaver Creek community! It has been wonderful to call Hills-Beaver Creek 'home' again. I was able to move into my office this week and also meet some incredible student-athletes who have been working hard this summer to prepare for their sport. Thank you to all the staff and community members who have popped in the high school office to welcome me. I'm so excited to be a Patriot!

With Patriot Pride,
Andrew Kellenberger
High School and Jr. High Principal
text:
Greetings Hills-Beaver Creek community! It has been wonderful to call Hills-Beaver Creek 'home' again. I was able to move into my office this week and also meet some incredible student-athletes who have been working hard this summer to prepare for their sport. Thank you to all the staff and community members who have popped in the high school office to welcome me. I'm so excited to be a Patriot!

With Patriot Pride,
Andrew Kellenberger
High School and Jr. High Principal

post_text: MN Gov. Walz just announced that the School Year will continue with Distance Learning through the end of May 2020. As of now, the HBC District will have Distance Learning through April 30, No Distance Learning 5/1 and 5/4 for planning. Distance Learning will continue on 5/5.

post_text: Our PBIS store is restocked! Thank you to Scott Harris with Coca-Cola and SMSU for the sweet swag!! Each week, students names are drawn from the ticket buckets to win either the “game pack” (free student admission + $2 at the concession stand), the “store”, or “breakfast club.” The extrinsic reward is fun, but the point of the tickets is to build relationships acknowledging students for meeting and exceeding expectations!
text: Our PBIS store is restocked! Thank you to Scott Harris with Coca-Cola and SMSU for the sweet swag!! Each week, students names are drawn from the ticket buckets to win either the “game pack” (free student admission + $2 at the concession stand), the “store”, or “breakfast club.” The extrinsic reward is fun, but the point of the tickets is to build relationships acknowledging students for meeting and exceeding expectations!

post_text: Mrs. Wysong teamed up with Dr. Zonnefeld from Dordt University (sponsored by the Dordt Noyce grant) to teach 10th - 12th grade math students about algorithms and statistics looking at March Madness. Students were encouraged to look at patterns and work as teams to find successful algorithms. The students will have an opportunity to compete with their new math skills during March Madness for a chance at Dordt Swag and a traveling trophy.
text: Mrs. Wysong teamed up with Dr. Zonnefeld from Dordt University (sponsored by the Dordt Noyce grant) to teach 10th - 12th grade math students about algorithms and statistics looking at March Madness. Students were encouraged to look at patterns and work as teams to find successful algorithms. The students will have an opportunity to compete with their new math skills during March Madness for a chance at Dordt Swag and a traveling trophy.
